parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name>game1</name>=<value> ofp

</value></part><part><name>version1</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game2</name>=<value> arma1

</value></part><part><name>version2</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game3</name>=<value> arma2

</value></part><part><name>version3</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game4</name>=<value> arma2oa

</value></part><part><name>version4</name>=<value> 1.51

</value></part><part><name>game5</name>=<value> tkoh

</value></part><part><name>version5</name>=<value> 1.00

</value></part><part><name>game6</name>=<value> arma3

</value></part><part><name>version6</name>=<value> 0.50

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Interaction

</value></part><part><name>descr</name>=<value> Shows or hides the GPS receiver on the map screen, if enabled for the mission and you possess the item. (default [[false]]). <template><title>Feature</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>In Arma 3 it shows/hides the minimap.</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>pr</name>=<value>  <template><title>GVI</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>2.02</value></part></template> This command is broken and does nothing. https://feedback.bistudio.com/T157028!

</value></part><part><name>s1</name>=<value> '''showGPS''' show

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> show: [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>r1</name>=<value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[showGPS]] [[true]];</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[shownGPS]], [[visibleGPS]], [[showCompass]], [[showRadio]], [[showWatch]], [[showPad]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on 16 Aug, 2009</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Generalcarver|GeneralCarver]]<dd class="note">
In Arma 2, the GPS is now an inventory item. Class path is CfgWeapons->ItemGPS. Use the commands addWeapon and removeWeapon to add or remove it from a unit's inventory. (example: player addweapon "ItemGPS") 


<dd class="notedate">Posted on 14 Jun, 2010</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:GalZohar|GalZohar]]<dd class="note">
In Arma 2 GPS is also an item, so will not be removed by removeAllWeapons, even though it can be removed by removeWeapon and added by addWeapon. To remove all items use the removeAllItems command (though this will also remove basic items such as map and compass).


<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
